com.panviva.util.pgc.processing

Class XslInstanceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.panviva.util.pgc.processing.XslInstanceManager

  • public class XslInstanceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The purpose of this class is to manage all of the details around document specific XSL files used to transform a partitioned and filtered (business rules processed) XHTML input file to the final SupportPoint importable xml file. The document specific xsl is dependent upon 2 embedded document specific files. These are: 1. A document specific XSL vars file generated by this class housing document specific variables needed by the XSL file. 2. A document specific folder tree XML file added to the output. This output XML tree file is generated during the post processing phase.
    Author:
    jcharles

      • createXslVarInstanceFile

        public void createXslVarInstanceFile()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method creates the document instance specific xslt vars file. This file is referenced in the main document instance specific xslt conversion file to provide document instance specific values for as part of the final stage conversion.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if issues arise generating the document specific XSLT vars file

      • processXslInstanceFile

        private void processXslInstanceFile()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method replaces the reference to the xsl vars file in the document instance specific xsl file with the instance specific xsl vars file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if an error occurs processing the XSLT document specific instance file

      • process

        public void process()
             throws java.io.IOException
        The main process method to createand process all the document instance specific xslt files required for the final stage document conversion.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if the XSLT transform fails to process the document specific xHtml document
